findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The transactions are initially disabled for all users excluding the authorized addresses. The owner can enable the transactions for all users. Once the transactions are enabled the owner will not be able to disable them again.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards. The `immutable` declaration can save gas when it is defined.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure their values cannot be changed after being set, which decreases gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Local scope variable shadowing occurs when a local variable with the same name as a variable in an outer scope is declared within a function or code block.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured from user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The `^` symbol indicates that any version of Solidity that is compatible with the specified version can be used to compile the contract. The version lock is a mechanism that allows the author to specify a minimum version of the Solidity compiler that must be used to compile the contract code.

findings.title: L22 - Potential Locked Ether
findings.description: The contract contains Ether that has been placed into a Solidity contract and is unable to be transferred, resulting in potential financial loss for users who have called the payable method.
